column4: I'm having some problems with the installation of Ubuntu. After it installed and reboots it stops at the black screen with the horizontal bar. Any ideas what to do?
hmm
Which graphics card?
How old is the computer?
black screen with horizontal bar, I guess you mean  boot up screen that went wrong
for the Wubi  did you use an ISO that you downloaded?
maybe just a bad download
still got the ISO?
puts a file on the Windows partition for Ubuntu

lap tops tend to get the problems,  and some computers Ubuntu doesn't like at all,  may depend on the version though.  However sometimes other distros work much better on a computer than Ubuntu,  but I would suggest trying a previous version of Ubuntu such as 10.04, before considering trying another distro.
same problem?
I am not sure which Nivida card you got, but its not a really fancy one right?
Ubuntu tends to work best with standard hardware
also as ace_steel is suggesting 9.10 may be a good idea to try
it may just be a Plymouth issue
the boot up
that 10.04 and 10.10 use
may be an issue with Plymouth itself, or just the way Ubuntu has done it.  9.10 uses Xsplash instead, and that may work better
9.10 also is still supported untill the end of April next year
make sure to md5sum check as well ideally
http://releases.ubuntu.com/9.10
and the codes you compare the ISO to are on that 9.10 section as well
